sentence.Network_en: Jack's inconsistent argument derange us all.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰克前后矛盾的争辩困扰了我们大家.

sentence.Network_en: So few men were present to derange the harmony of the wilderness.
sentence.Network_cn: 极少有人去扰乱林子里的平静.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French déranger, from Old French desrengier, literally 'move from orderly rows'

means.word_mean: 1. derange mentally, throw out of mental balance; make insane;

sentences.sentence: "The death of his parents unbalanced him"

means.word_mean: 2. throw into great confusion or disorder;

sentences.sentence: "Fundamental Islamicists threaten to perturb the social order in Algeria and Egypt"

auth_sentence.content: Marriage, in "Eat, Pray, Love," is a prison, destined to derange its female inmates.
